001/*

004 */
005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.CustomCollectors;
009
010import org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager;
011import org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger;
012
013import java.util.List;
014import java.util.Map;
015import java.util.ServiceLoader;
016import java.util.ServiceLoader.Provider;
017import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
018import java.util.function.Function;
019import java.util.stream.Collectors;
020
021import javax.xml.namespace.QName;
022
023import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
024import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
025import nl.talsmasoftware.lazy4j.Lazy;
026
027/**
028 * This class provides a singleton service to allow data types to be discovered
029 * within the system based on an SPI provided by {@link IDataTypeProvider}.
030 */
031public final class DataTypeService {
032  private static final Logger LOGGER = LogManager.getLogger(DataTypeService.class);
033  private static final Lazy<DataTypeService> INSTANCE = Lazy.lazy(() -> new DataTypeService());
034
035  private final Map<String, IDataTypeAdapter<?>> typeByName;
036  private final Map<QName, IDataTypeAdapter<?>> typeByQName;
037  private final Map<Class<? extends IDataTypeAdapter<?>>, IDataTypeAdapter<?>> typeByClass;
038
039  /**
040   * Get the singleton service instance, which will be lazy constructed on first
041   * access.
042   *
043   * @return the service instance
044   */
045  @SuppressWarnings("null")
046  @NonNull
047  public static DataTypeService getInstance() {
048    return INSTANCE.get();
049  }
050
051  private DataTypeService() {
052
053    ServiceLoader<IDataTypeProvider> loader = ServiceLoader.load(IDataTypeProvider.class);
054    List<IDataTypeAdapter<?>> dataTypes = loader.stream()
055        .map(Provider<IDataTypeProvider>::get)
056        .flatMap(provider -> provider.getJavaTypeAdapters().stream())
057        .collect(Collectors.toList());
058
059    Map<String, IDataTypeAdapter<?>> typeByName = dataTypes.stream()
060        .flatMap(dataType -> dataType.getNames().stream()
061            .map(qname -> Map.entry(qname.getLocalPart(), dataType)))
062        .collect(CustomCollectors.toMap(
063            Map.Entry::getKey,
064            Map.Entry::getValue,
065            (key, v1, v2) -> {
066              if (LOGGER.isWarnEnabled()) {
067                LOGGER.warn("Data types '{}' and '{}' have duplicate name '{}'. Using the first.",
068                    v1.getClass().getName(),
069                    v2.getClass().getName(),
070                    key);
071              }
072              return v1;
073            },
074            ConcurrentHashMap::new));
075
076    Map<QName, IDataTypeAdapter<?>> typeByQName = dataTypes.stream()
077        .flatMap(dataType -> dataType.getNames().stream()
078            .map(qname -> Map.entry(qname, dataType)))
079        .collect(CustomCollectors.toMap(
080            Map.Entry::getKey,
081            Map.Entry::getValue,
082            (key, v1, v2) -> {
083              if (LOGGER.isWarnEnabled()) {
084                LOGGER.warn("Data types '{}' and '{}' have duplicate name '{}'. Using the first.",
085                    v1.getClass().getName(),
086                    v2.getClass().getName(),
087                    key);
088              }
089              return v1;
090            },
091            ConcurrentHashMap::new));
092
093    @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked", "null" }) Map<Class<? extends IDataTypeAdapter<?>>,
094        IDataTypeAdapter<?>> typeByClass = dataTypes.stream()
095            .collect(CustomCollectors.toMap(
096                dataType -> (Class<? extends IDataTypeAdapter<?>>) dataType.getClass(),
097                Function.identity(),
098                (key, v1, v2) -> {
099                  if (LOGGER.isWarnEnabled()) {
100                    LOGGER.warn("Duplicate data type class '{}'. Using the first.",
101                        key.getClass().getName());
102                  }
103                  return v1;
104                },
105                ConcurrentHashMap::new));
106    this.typeByName = typeByName;
107    this.typeByQName = typeByQName;
108    this.typeByClass = typeByClass;
109  }
110
111  /**
112   * Lookup a specific {@link IDataTypeAdapter} instance by its name.
113   *
114   * @param qname
115   *          the qualified name of data type adapter to get the instance for
116   * @return the instance or {@code null} if the instance is unknown to the type
117   *         system
118   */
119  @Nullable
120  public IDataTypeAdapter<?> getJavaTypeAdapterByQName(@NonNull QName qname) {
121    return typeByQName.get(qname);
122  }
123
124  /**
125   * Lookup a specific {@link IDataTypeAdapter} instance by its name.
126   *
127   * @param name
128   *          the name of data type adapter to get the instance for
129   * @return the instance or {@code null} if the instance is unknown to the type
130   *         system
131   */
132  @Nullable
133  public IDataTypeAdapter<?> getJavaTypeAdapterByName(@NonNull String name) {
134    return typeByName.get(name);
135  }
136
137  /**
138   * Lookup a specific {@link IDataTypeAdapter} instance by its class.
139   *
140   * @param clazz
141   *          the adapter class to get the instance for
142   * @param <TYPE>
143   *          the type of the requested adapter
144   * @return the instance or {@code null} if the instance is unknown to the type
145   *         system
146   */
147  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
148  @Nullable
149  public <TYPE extends IDataTypeAdapter<?>> TYPE getJavaTypeAdapterByClass(@NonNull Class<TYPE> clazz) {
150    return (TYPE) typeByClass.get(clazz);
151  }
152}
